context: The Finnish word 'sai' is the past tense third-person singular form of the verb 'saada', which means 'to get' or 'to receive'. It indicates that someone received or obtained something in the past. The verb changes its ending based on the subject and tense: 'sain' (I got), 'sait' (you got), 'sai' (he/she/it got), 'saimme' (we got), 'saitte' (you plural/formal got), 'sivat' (they got).
